Key Arguments: The legislation will degrade public trust in government and media.
The Bill's authoritarian approach will foster disunity and decrease trust.
The exemption of government-authorized content is irresponsible and creates a double standard.
The Bill is likened to authoritarian regimes, which is not suitable for Australia.
Notable Quotes: This proposed Bill to combat 'misinformation and disinformation' must be wholly rejected.
Its authoritarian approach will further decrease trust in our governments.
I consider it incredible that a government would be willing to make a law and then exempt itself from that law.
This Bill is of the same ilk as a proposal that someone might expect under a Soviet-style, communist regime.
